Description: Glazed composition figure fragment. Naked boy riding a quadruped, probably a lion (?) or great cat (?); human figure broken off above waist, and at ankles; animal, missing head and legs, variously broken; fragment of tail survives at back; glaze greenish, with luminous surface; core- dark buff, very hard.
Curator's comments: The faience object was analysed by proton induced X-ray emission spectrometry (PIXE) under a 3 MeV energy proton beam for characterisation of the elemental chemical composition (major, minor and trace elements), in March 2014, by the Centre de Recherche et de Restauration des Musées de France (C2RMF).
Bibliographic references: Roman Pottery / Catalogue of the Roman Pottery in the British Museum (K12)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (ON.04)
